Name: Old project incompatibility
Statement: Changes to the source code may result in old projects being incompatible with newer versions of Facile.
Description: If data is serialized (written to disk as binary files) there may be problems with deserializing data (constructing objects from binary files) because the newer classes don't match the older classes.
Action Plan: Look into other project formats that are not dependent on source code remaining unchanged.

Name: GUI Component Reidentification
Statement: We may not be able to reidentify GUI components consistently.
Description: Component reidentification relies heavily on the functionality and reliability of the component token generation and comparison processes. Since tokens will rarely be 100% similar, there is always a risk of misidentifying a component or vice versa, and it is difficult to estimate at this time the average success rate that will come from the component reidentification
Action Plan: Find as many unique identifiers as possible to store in tokens, and develop an algorithm/statistical method to compare two tokens with a certain probability of certainty

Name: Index Organization
Statement: We may fail to make sure the index that has been deleted is actually the index that was supposed to be deleted.
Description: If the wrong index gets deleted it could crash the program.
Action Plan: Provide a unique identifier to each data item and be sure to save the latest item if each have the same data.

Name: Reconstructing project structure
Statement: It is possible that not all internal data can be easily reconstructed when a project is loaded by simply using the pickle module.
Description: There may be a specific order required to rebuild internal data structures that were created before a project was saved and closed.
Action Plan: Determine which data structures are pickleable and which ones will need to be recreated by calling constructors.

Name: Visibility Behavior Conditionals
Statement: We may fail to come up with a system for allowing the user to define logical conditions determining if visibility behaviors are followed.
Description: A visibility behavior may be dependant on whether user input in the target GUI is valid. Therefore visibility behaviors should be configurable to reflect this reality. This will require that a visibilty behavior contain information about how to get data from the target GUI. How to implement this functionality is unclear.
Action Plan: Develop the VisibilityBehavior class so it contains a Conditional class. The Conditional class will have references to the target GUI components which contain the data that will be used in the conditional statement.

Name: Restoring graphics upon load
Statement: When a project is loaded, it may be difficult to restore the graphics to their original state.
Description: The Graphics will rely on the underlying data structure for the target GUI AND manual positioning.
Action Plan: Make sure to store coordinates, sizes, colors, line weight, etc. of each item that is in the graphics view so that the objects can be serialized/deserialized easily.

Name: Target GUI Incompatability
Statement: We may fail to detect that a target GUI is incompatible.
Description: If the user chooses an application that was not developed with one of the compatible frameworks (MFC, VB6, VCL, WinForms, WPF, Store apps, and Qt5) then we won't be able to detect GUI components correctly.
Action Plan: When application is started, probe for components. If None were found inside the main window, raise an exception.

Name: GUI Mapping Incompatability
Statement: We may fail to map one or more components and behaviors in the target GUI.
Description: If the GUI contains component or behavior that is not included in one of the compatible frameworks (MFC, VB6, VCL, WinForms, WPF, Store apps, and Qt5), Facile may not be able to map the component or behavior.
Action Plan: If an exception arises, rise a flagg in the software.

Name: Speed Requirement
Statement: We may fail to map the GUI under 1 min.
Description: If the GUI contains a large number of components, Facile may not be able to display in the entire GUI in a relatively short time.
Action Plan: Improve the algorithm. Save time on traversing.

Name: Bad User-defined Visibility Conditionals
Statement: A user may define illogical visibility behavior conditionals.
Description: Illogical visibility behavior conditionals may affect how the "API Modules" are defined.
Action Plan: We will catch these invalid behaviors with the validator to make the user change them before compilation.

Name: Overuse of RAM
Statement: We may fail to use less than or equal to 2 GB of RAM while operating.
Description: If the user has big projects or projects that have been open for a while, the indexes could go out of scope and get deleted.
Action Plan: Use a custom data structure that removes irrelevant persistent indexes.

Name: Input of Properties
Statement: We may fail to compact what a user can input into the property editor.
Description: If the editor is to flexible then improper data could be added.
Action Plan: Implement a function to constrict the kind of properties that will be accepeted.

Name: Property Values
Statement: We may fail to display values of a property as a drop down menu.
Description: If the values aren't found as a drop down menu then it would be just inefficient for the user.
Action Plan: Implement a function to have the model displayed as a drop down menu.

Name: Size the component
Statement: The size of the parent node may not be able to hold the children nodes.
Description: If the user adds a extensive amount of components under one window, the window may not have enough space to hold all the widgets.
Action Plan: Design the window in a way that it could automatically re-size itself to hold all the new widgets.

Name: Arrow routing
Statement: The arrow may be directed to the target component in a straight line.
Description: One arrow may need to go around different components to go to the tartget widegt.
Action Plan: Design an alogorithm to allow the arrow to go through the entire mapped GUI to find the target component.

Name: Visibility Behavior QtModel interface
Statement: We may fail to implement the QtModel for visibility behaviors.
Description: The QtModel is the part of Qt's model/view framework which will interface views to the underlying model data. The developer has yet to prototype this.
Action Plan: Prototype the QtModel using example code as a guide.
